page.title: 08ADULT/SPECIAL EDUCATION
page.content: There are two special schools in the area;Wyresdale serves the children with severe educational disabilities of a physical and mental nature. The school has 40 pupils and 8 teaching staff. Fylde Farm is technically a community home and assessment centre. The community home offers a home for the rehabilitation of juveniles under 17 years who have committed some offence. The assessment centre is a secure institution where juveniles waiting for a court hearing are assessed on their physical and educational abilities. During the three to four weeks they are there, only basic English and Maths are taught. Adult education throughout the Wyre District is in the form of Day and Evening classes. Places are much in demand, which far outstrips supply.
